Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: ENC 1102 and Consent of Honors, or CI

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Environmental politics through the lens of "sustainability." Attention devoted to the relationships of culture, economics, and ecology.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Politics, Security, and International Affairs

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Areas of public policy such as immigration, education, trade, taxation, and fiscal policy in selected countries.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An examination of politics and policymaking concerning issues of conservation, pollution and development of land, air, and water resources.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Historical and contemporary role of minority groups in the American political process, including an examination of their electoral significance and relevant legislative, executive, and judicial policies.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Politics, Security, and International Affairs

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of interface between science and government. Focus is upon governmental support for science, social accountability, and the role of the scientist-policy maker in comparative context.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Politics, Security, and International Affairs

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Analysis of public policies regarding business. Study includes various levels of government including international organizations.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Politics, Security, and International Affairs

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Western education and the connection between citizenship and education, education funding, and the politics of education reform.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Politics, Security, and International Affairs

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Intensive analysis of a current policy problem. Sample topics include education, growth management, housing, affirmative action, welfare, and transportation.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Politics, Security, and International Affairs

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Public policy, ecology, and the urban political landscape explored by tracing their development and prospects for sustainable cities.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Politics, Security, and International Affairs

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Public policies and processes that achieve a disparate impact on women and women's lives in the United States.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: School of Politics, Security, and International Affairs

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An examination of the politics and policy-making involved with the US space program in the context of domestic demands and other international space programs.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Policy formation, implementation and evaluation, with a focus upon contemporary American problems, including the malapportionment of societal power and social conflict.
